courseDetails.title: Masterclass Cryptoactifs: Tout sur les Altcoins, NFT, DeFi
courseDetails.shortDescription: Tout ce que vous devez savoir sur les cryptos, les altcoins, le bitcoin, les NFT, le DeFi, et le Metaverse
courseDetails.longDescription:
Ce cours explique tout ce dont vous avez besoin de connaître sur les cryptomonnaies et comment accéder aux meilleures opportunités de cette industrie. Depuis la création de la crypto-monnaie, les personnes qui ne savent presque rien à ce sujet sont prêtes à payer pour savoir comment cela fonctionne.

L’industrie de la monnaie numérique a connu une grande affluence de cryptos au fil des ans et d’autres sont actuellement en cours de développement. Vous en apprendrez davantage sur l’une des technologies les plus récentes de l’industrie: le métavers. Le métavers est en train de devenir la prochaine grande chose dans l’histoire de l’humanité offrant différents avantages aux gens quel que soit leur niveau d’expérience. C’est un pont entre la réalité physique et la réalité virtuelle, et il révolutionne actuellement beaucoup de nos activités en tant qu’humains. Ce développement technologique a eu un impact positif sur des domaines tels que le divertissement, la médecine, l’éducation et bien d’autres. Ce cours vous éclairera sur les utilisations possibles de cette technologie et sur la façon dont vous pouvez les exploiter.

L’une des nombreuses choses que vous apprendrez est l’introduction générale à l’argent traditionnel que nous connaissons tous, en outre, vous en apprendrez davantage sur le contexte et l’origine de Bitcoin. En cours de route, vous apprendrez comment le Bitcoin, les Altcoins, les Meme coins, la DeFi, les NFTs et le Metaverse fonctionnent tous et pourquoi la blockchain est d’une grande importance en matière de crypto.

Vous en apprendrez également davantage sur les différents aspects de l’exploitation minière et du trading de crypto-monnaie, ainsi que sur les stratégies et tactiques impliquées pour vous aider à croître, à créer et à accumuler de la richesse. Nous ne pouvons pas parler de crypto-monnaies sans mentionner les portefeuilles cryptographiques, leur applicabilités, les différents types que nous avons, ainsi que la façon de les utiliser.

Pourquoi choisir ce cours?

Adapté aux débutants: Le cours a des instructeurs professionnels qui sont bien aguerris et qui connaissent le savoir-faire de Bitcoin et sont toujours disponibles pour vous mettre à travers le processus d’apprentissage.

Aucun codage n’est nécessaire pour apprendre comment fonctionne Bitcoin et comment vous pouvez l’utiliser à votre avantage, tout ce qui est exigé de vous est votre temps, votre dévouement et un bon téléphone avec accès à Internet.


Rejoignez-nous dans la Masterclass Crypto Ultime: Métavers, Opportunités, NFT, Meme Coins, DeFi, Bitcoin, Altcoins, Mining, et bien plus encore!

Si vous cherchez à prendre le train en marche de la tendance actuelle de la crypto-monnaie et que vous ne savez pas comment vous y prendre, alors ce cours est pour vous. Ce cours explique les tactiques de travail et les principes de la crypto-monnaie et de ses différents composants. Ce cours est tout ce dont vous avez besoin!
targetAudiences: Les développeurs et les entrepreneurs Web qui sont prêts à élargir leurs frontières commerciales et qui sont enclins à savoir comment Bitcoin et Blockchain affecteront le monde des affaires
Tous ceux qui ont entendu parler de la crypto-monnaie et qui veulent en tirer de l’argent

In the fast-paced world we live in, convenience is key. With the rise of online food delivery services, the food and courier industry has witnessed a significant transformation. Today, we will explore the different aspects of this industry, focusing on collection jobs, delivery jobs, and the importance of customer feedback.

The collection job plays a crucial role in the food and courier industry. It involves picking up orders from restaurants or food outlets and ensuring they are ready for delivery. Timeliness and efficiency are paramount in this role, as any delays can negatively impact the customer's experience.

Once the orders are collected, the delivery job takes center stage. Delivery personnel are responsible for transporting the orders from the restaurant or food outlet to the customer's location. This role requires individuals to be well-versed in navigation, as they must find the most efficient routes to ensure timely deliveries.

Customer feedback is invaluable in the food and courier industry. It provides valuable insights into the overall customer experience, allowing companies to identify areas for improvement.

The food and courier industry has revolutionized the way we enjoy our meals. Collection jobs and delivery jobs are the backbone of this industry, ensuring that orders reach customers promptly and efficiently. Furthermore, customer feedback plays a vital role in shaping and improving the services provided. As the industry continues to evolve, it is crucial for companies to adapt and embrace customer feedback to deliver the best possible experience.

The second module covers the most important tools and equipment that you’ll need as a car electrician. You’ll learn about the different types of multimeters, oscilloscopes, and diagnostic tools, as well as the various types of wire and cable that are used in electrical systems.

The third module covers car tuning. You’ll learn how to diagnose and fix common electrical problems such as alternator failure, battery drain, and starter issues. You’ll also learn about advanced topics such as wiring harnesses, grounding, and circuit protection.

The fourth module is dedicated to car repair. You’ll learn how to diagnose and fix common mechanical problems, such as engine failure, transmission issues, and suspension problems. You’ll also learn about the different types of tools and equipment that are used in car repair, as well as safety procedures that are essential when working on cars.

The final module of the course covers the business side of car electrician training. You’ll learn about how to set up a successful car electrician business, including marketing, pricing, and customer service. You’ll also learn about the different types of certifications and licenses that are required to operate a car electrician business, as well as legal and financial considerations.

By the end of the course, you’ll have the skills and knowledge you need to become a successful car electrician. You’ll be able to diagnose and fix common electrical problems, tune a car for optimal performance, and perform advanced repairs on all types of vehicles. You’ll also have a solid understanding of the business side of car electrician training, which will help you build a successful career in this exciting field.

Enroll today and take the first step towards becoming a skilled car electrician!

courseDetails.title: Print on Demand 2023: From Zero to Profitable Business
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Print-on-Demand: Learn Niche Research, Store Setup, Design, Marketing Strategies, and Launch E-Commerce Business
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to this comprehensive course on launching and managing a successful print-on-demand e-commerce store using Launch Cart and Printful.


In this course, we will guide you through the entire process of setting up your online store from scratch, starting from niche research and selection, creating a business name, registering a domain, designing a logo and landing pages, all the way through to managing your products and marketing your store.


Section 1: Overview

We will start with a brief overview of what's inside this course, followed by an in-depth explanation of how print-on-demand works and why Launch Cart is the best platform to use for your e-commerce store. You will learn about the expectations and profit potential of print-on-demand, and why it is a smart choice for anyone looking to start an online business.


Section 2: Getting Started

Next, we will dive into the initial steps of creating your store. We will cover niche research and selection, and guide you through the process of finding a business name that resonates with your brand. We will also provide you with tips on how to conduct domain name research and registration, and show you how to create an attractive logo and designs that capture the essence of your brand.


Section 3: Setting Up Store

Once you have your branding in place, we will show you how to set up your store using Launch Cart. We will guide you through the process of signing up and provide an overview of the Launch Cart dashboard. You will learn how to connect Printful with Launch Cart, set up Printful settings, and create custom pages, landing/sales pages, and store themes. You will also learn how to customize checkout pages and menus, connect a custom domain to your store, and set up shipping and taxes. We will also show you how to boost your conversion rates using abandoned carts and how to make admin customizations.


Section 4: Store Management

Now that your store is set up, we will show you how to manage it effectively. You will learn how to add new products, including adding products from Printful, managing sales and coupons, managing customers and reviews, managing inventory, and even managing multiple stores. We will also show you how to offer bumper offers and upsells to your customers to maximize your profits.


Section 5: Product Design

Product design is a critical aspect of your print-on-demand store, and in this section, we will guide you through the process of designing your products. We will show you how to purchase designs, use Canva for designing, and even design using AI.


Section 6: Paid Marketing Strategies

In this section, we will dive into the different paid marketing strategies that you can use to drive traffic and sales to your store. You will learn about paid ads, the best ad strategy, influencer marketing, and creating video ads and mockups.


Section 7: Free Traffic Sources

Free traffic sources can be just as effective as paid marketing, and we will show you how to take advantage of them. We will cover the use of coupons and sales, affiliate marketing, Pinterest, live streams, email marketing, list building, Quora and Reddit, and even Tiktok, Shorts, and Reels.



By the end of this course, you will have a fully functional, profitable print-on-demand eCommerce store, with the knowledge and skills to manage and market it effectively. Join us now and start your journey to success in the online business world!
targetAudiences: Anyone who wants to start a print-on-demand business.

courseDetails.title: Excel Accounting Problem
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn How to Create an Accounting Worksheet Using Microsoft Excel from a Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
courseDetails.longDescription:
This course will walk through a comprehensive accounting problem using Microsoft Excel in a step-by-step process. You may also use another spreadsheet software like Google Sheets.

Learners will learn how to navigate Microsoft Excel as well as how to create a well-designed accounting worksheet, complete with a general journal, trial balance, general ledger, subsidiary ledgers for accounts receivable, accounts payable, & inventory, financial statements and much more.

Excel is a very good tool to learn accounting because it is much more transparent than a database program, like accounting software, QuickBooks being a common example of accounting software.

As we enter transactions into our Microsoft Excel worksheet, we will discuss how the data input would commonly be entered into accounting software like QuickBooks and what data input forms would normally drive the transactions.

The course will start out from a blank Excel Worksheet. We will build the outline for our accounting system from the blank spreadsheet.

For each new step in the process, you will have access to a downloadable Excel Workbook, containing at least two tabs, one with the answer, the new steps being completed, the other starting out where the prior presentation left off.

Therefore, you can complete the entire problem starting from one blank spreadsheet, or you can jump forward in the problem and rework any component of the problem by downloading the related worksheet at that point in the process.

After constructing the outline of our accounting worksheet, the first section will discuss the most common accounting transactions and the data input form often used in accounting software, like QuickBooks, to enter them, common data input forms including invoice, bill, deposit. . .

We will then start our comprehensive problem, constructing a new Excel worksheet and entering beginning balances into it, imagining that we had a prior accounting system which we are now converting to our new accounting system in Excel.

We will then enter two-months worth of data input. When entering the accounting data we will create the journal entry, post it to the trial balance, giving us a good look at which accounts are impacted, post to the general ledger, and make adjustments to any subsidiary ledgers needed.

We will also update the financial statements periodically.

For the second month of operations, we create a bit more complex trial balance, allowing us to calculate both the year-to-date numbers, including both months of data input, and the current period numbers, showing income statement accounts for just the second month of operations.

After entering two months of data input, we will process two bank reconciliations, using mock bank statements. As we construct our bank reconciliations, we will discuss how accounting software often accomplishes this task.

Next, we will adjust our worksheet to enter period end adjusting journal entries as well as reversing entries. For each adjusting entry we will consider the reasons for it and how to set up the accounting system so that our adjusting entries do not mess up the data input process in the accounting department.

After entering the adjusting entries we will construct our financial statements.
targetAudiences: Anyone who wants to learn Excel, real world practice problems being the best tool
Anybody learning accounting or bookkeeping
Anybody who uses accounting software like QuickBooks and wants to understand what the software is doing
Accounting students and professionals

courseDetails.title: The Concept of  Waste
courseDetails.shortDescription: Reduce waste and streamline value flow
courseDetails.longDescription:
Companies are always looking for new ways to improve business efficiency and increase quality. To run a business at optimal capacity, you need to reduce or eliminate waste from processes and improve production flow. In this course, you'll learn about Lean strategies to reduce waste by determining which operations add value and which don't. You'll explore the concept of continuous flow, and discover how to balance work processes to make production flow more efficient. You'll define what waste is, where it exists, and what causes it. You'll also examine aspects of Muda, continuous flow, line balancing, value and non-value-add, and practical Lean techniques for improving Operations Management.

What is waste in Lean Manufacturing?

A core principle in lean methodology is the removal of waste within an operation. And in any business, one of the heaviest drains on profitability is waste. Lean waste can come in the form of time, material, and labor. But it may also be related to the utilization of skill-sets as well as poor planning. In lean manufacturing, waste is any expense or effort that is expended but which does not transform raw materials into an item the customer is willing to pay for. By optimizing process steps and eliminating waste, the only true value is added at each phase of production.

Today, the Lean Manufacturing model recognizes 8 types of waste within an operation; seven originally conceived when the Toyota Production System was first conceived, and an eighth added when the lean methodology was adopted within the Western World. Seven of the eight wastes are production process-oriented, while the eighth waste is directly related to management’s ability to utilize personnel.

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN to

  1. classify production activities as a value-add, non-value-add, or necessary non-value-add.

  2. identify strategies for eliminating waste caused by overproduction and inventory.

  3. identify strategies for eliminating motion, waiting, and transportation waste.

  4. identify elimination strategies for waste caused by overprocessing and defects

  5. match cycle time and takt time to their descriptions

  6. identify the final three steps for balancing a production line
targetAudiences: Any professional, who is seeking career growth in the quality management sector

Managers, Supervisors, Team Leaders, CEO, and Senior Managers, who want to encourage continuous improvement for an organisation and responsible for developing lean thinking, practical skills, measurement of production staff, and analysing the performance of the employee in the workplace.
Individuals involved in a continuous improvement project who needs a complete overview of the process

The concept of the metaverse has gained significant attention and momentum in recent years, presenting both challenges and opportunities for individuals and businesses alike. The Metaverse Expert Assessment is designed to assess knowledge and proficiency in this domain, providing a valuable tool for individuals and organizations to gauge their expertise and identify areas for further development.

Demonstrating Expertise: By completing the Metaverse Expert Assessment, employees can showcase their knowledge and understanding of the metaverse. This certification can serve as a valuable asset when seeking career opportunities in metaverse-related fields, such as virtual reality, augmented reality, gaming, digital marketing, and more.

The assessment allows employees to identify their strengths and weaknesses, empowering them to focus on areas that require further development. A strong foundation in metaverse concepts, technologies, and implications can open doors to exciting career paths and leadership roles within forward-thinking organizations.

Future-Proofing Skills: The metaverse represents the convergence of various technologies, including virtual reality, augmented reality, blockchain, artificial intelligence, and more. Acquiring expertise in these areas through the assessment ensures employees remain competitive and adaptable as the metaverse industry continues to grow and evolve.


Benefits for Companies:

Identifying Skill Gaps: The Metaverse Expert Assessment enables companies to assess the metaverse proficiency of their employees and identify areas where additional training and development may be required. This insight allows organizations to create targeted learning programs that address skill gaps, ensuring a knowledgeable and skilled workforce.

Guiding Recruitment Strategies: As the metaverse industry expands, companies will seek to attract top talent with the required expertise. The assessment serves as a valuable tool for evaluating potential candidates, enabling companies to identify individuals who possess the necessary skills and knowledge to drive their metaverse initiatives forward.

Strategic Decision-Making: Companies operating within the metaverse space must make informed decisions regarding technology adoption, product development, marketing strategies, and more. Having employees with a deep understanding of the metaverse through the assessment equips companies with the insights needed to make strategic choices aligned with industry trends and consumer demands.


Building a Career in Metaverse Development and Marketing:

The Metaverse Expert Assessment serves as an invaluable resource for individuals looking to build a career in the metaverse industry. By acquiring expertise in metaverse development and marketing, individuals can position themselves for exciting and dynamic roles within organizations at the forefront of this transformative technology.

Technical Roles: Metaverse development requires a range of technical skills, including programming, virtual reality design, 3D modeling, and user interface development. The assessment provides a foundation for individuals seeking careers as metaverse developers, designers, or software engineers.

Marketing and Business Roles: As the metaverse expands, companies will require professionals with a deep understanding of metaverse marketing strategies, user behavior, and monetization models. The assessment equips individuals with the knowledge and insights necessary for roles in metaverse marketing, product management, business development, and more.

Research and Innovation: The metaverse is a frontier for innovation, offering exciting opportunities for research and development. Individuals with a passion for exploring new technologies, user experiences, and the societal impact of the metaverse can leverage the assessment to build careers in research, innovation, and thought leadership.

courseDetails.title: Project Finance Overview - From Inception to Financial Close
courseDetails.shortDescription: How infrastructure projects are financed around the world
courseDetails.longDescription:
Infrastructure Finance, also called Project Finance, is not just another form of investment banking. It finances our roads and our bridges, our hospitals and our power stations. It breathes life into our economy.  In this course, you will learn how infrastructure deals are financed and what makes them so complicated.  The course covers project finance structures, risk mitigation and provides insights from subject matter experts.  It also includes insights from the top-rated Financial Modelling Podcast, as well as supporting material such as example contracts and loan agreements.

Matthew Bernath, the trainer, has been intricately involved in the financing of large infrastructure deals, including renewable energy plants, toll roads, property and other infrastructure.  He was previously a specialist Project Finance Modeller and hosts the Financial Modelling Podcast.  Matthew has worked on or advised Infrastructure Deals throughout Africa.

Project Finance focuses on the financing of long-term infrastructure.  Given the size of these projects, the structuring of these deals is complex and often governs how projects are constructed and operated over time periods of up to 20 or 30 years.  As infrastructure generally benefits the wider public, Project Finance can involve both Public (Government) and Private Parties.  When the government and the private sector come together to enable infrastructure to be constructed and operated, it is referred to as Public-Private Partnerships or PPPs.   

The course covers a high-level overview of project finance modelling and does not contain any project finance modelling exercises; however, overviews of Project Finance models are provided via videos.

What is SciPy?

SciPy is an open-source scientific computation library that builds on NumPy, facilitating more mathematically inclined operations. It's widely used in scientific and technical computing with functionalities like optimization, integration, interpolation, eigenvalue problems, and more.

Who should use SciPy?

SciPy is a powerful tool for anyone involved in data analysis, scientific computing, or engineering, but it's also highly beneficial for researchers, students, data scientists, and machine learning engineers.

What prerequisites are required for using SciPy?

Basic knowledge of Python is required to use SciPy. It's also beneficial to have an understanding of NumPy due to its close integration with SciPy. Familiarity with mathematical concepts relevant to your specific use case will also be useful.

How is SciPy different from NumPy?

While both are used for mathematical and numerical analysis, NumPy is more focused on numerical operations like handling arrays, whereas SciPy provides more advanced functions such as integration, optimization, and signal and image processing.

How do I install SciPy?

You can install SciPy using pip with the command pip install scipy. It is also included if you install a Python distribution like Anaconda.

What are some common use-cases for SciPy?

SciPy is used in a wide range of domains including physics, statistics, engineering, and more. It's used for image processing, signal processing, statistical analysis, and even in machine learning algorithms.

How can I improve my SciPy skills?

Regular practice and working on real-world projects can significantly improve your SciPy skills. Cours d’introduction à la logistique internationale

Ce cours est conçu pour donner aux étudiants une compréhension approfondie de la logistique internationale. Il couvre divers aspects de la logistique, y compris le commerce international, les flux de commerce et le transport international.

Partie  1: La logistique du commerce international

Dans ce cours, nous explorerons les éléments clés de la logistique du commerce international. Nous aborderons des sujets tels que l’importance de la logistique dans le commerce international, les défis et les opportunités, ainsi que les techniques et stratégies utilisées pour optimiser la logistique dans ce domaine.

Partie  2: Les flux du commerce international

Ce cours traite des différents flux impliqués dans le commerce international. Nous examinerons les flux de biens, d’informations et de finances et comment ces flux sont gérés efficacement pour assurer un commerce international fluide.

Partie  3: La logistique du transport international

Le dernier volet de ce cours se concentre sur la logistique du transport international. Nous discuterons des différents modes de transport utilisés en commerce international, de l’importance de choisir le mode de transport approprié, et des défis logistiques que pose le transport international.

En somme, ce cours offre une introduction complète à la logistique internationale, permettant aux étudiants d’acquérir une compréhension solide de la façon dont les produits sont acheminés efficacement à travers les frontières.

courseDetails.title: Teaching Methods, Teaching Quality & Teaching Delivery 3.0
courseDetails.shortDescription: Teaching Methods, Teaching Quality, Teacher Training, Teaching Delivery, Pedagogy, Teaching Online, Adult Education
courseDetails.longDescription:
Teaching Methods, Teaching Quality & Teaching Delivery 3.0

This course aims to equip aspiring educators with the fundamental principles and practical strategies necessary to excel in teaching. Participants will explore various teaching methods, analyze factors that contribute to teaching quality, and develop effective teaching delivery techniques. Through a combination of theory, hands-on activities, and real-world examples, learners will gain the knowledge and skills required to become effective and impactful educators.

Teaching is a noble art that plays a pivotal role in shaping the minds of future generations. The journey of education begins with understanding the foundation of teaching and learning. Teachers must familiarize themselves with various teaching methods and pedagogies to create an enriching and stimulating learning environment for their students.

To start, let's explore the diverse range of teaching methods and pedagogies available. From traditional lectures and discussions to more interactive approaches like group work, project-based learning, and flipped classrooms, each method serves unique purposes and caters to different learning styles. Understanding these options allows teachers to tailor their lessons effectively.

Learning Objectives for Teaching Methods:

  1. Understand the various teaching methods and their characteristics, such as lecture-based, interactive, experiential, and online teaching approaches.

  2. Identify the strengths and weaknesses of different teaching methods in different educational contexts.

  3. Learn how to select appropriate teaching methods based on the learning objectives, content, and the needs of diverse learners.

  4. Apply effective teaching methods to engage students actively in the learning process and enhance their understanding of the subject matter.

  5. Demonstrate the ability to adapt and modify teaching methods based on student feedback and learning outcomes.

  6. Evaluate the impact of different teaching methods on student performance and motivation.

Learning Objectives for Teaching Quality:

  1. Define and recognize the key components of teaching quality, including content expertise, pedagogical knowledge, communication skills, and classroom management.

  2. Identify the characteristics of a positive and inclusive learning environment that promotes student engagement, respect, and academic growth.

  3. Assess and implement strategies to maintain high standards of teaching and continually improve instructional practices.

  4. Learn to provide constructive feedback and support to students to foster their academic and personal development.

  5. Understand the importance of ongoing professional development to enhance teaching quality and keep up with best practices in education.

  6. Demonstrate the ability to self-reflect on teaching practices and use student feedback to refine instructional methods.

Learning Objectives for Teaching Delivery:

  1. Develop effective communication skills to deliver course content clearly and engagingly.

  2. Master the use of multimedia tools and technology to enhance teaching delivery and support student learning.

  3. Learn how to manage time efficiently during lessons and maintain a proper pace to cover course material effectively.

  4. Demonstrate the ability to adapt teaching delivery to accommodate diverse learning styles and student needs.

  5. Understand the role of active learning techniques in promoting student participation and understanding.

  6. Explore methods to encourage student interaction and facilitate productive discussions during lectures and class activities.

By achieving these learning objectives, educators can become more proficient in employing various teaching methods, ensuring high-quality teaching practices, and delivering engaging and effective lessons, leading to better student outcomes and a more enriching learning experience.

As educators, our mission is to empower students to become lifelong learners, critical thinkers, and active contributors to society. By understanding the fundamentals of teaching and learning, adapting to diverse learners, engaging and motivating students, utilizing effective teaching techniques, integrating technology thoughtfully, and mastering classroom and time management, we can unlock the true potential of education. Let us embark on this transformative journey together, embracing the art of effective teaching to shape a brighter future for generations to come.

In this master course, I would like to teach the 5 major topics:

1: Introduction to Teaching and Learning, Teaching Methods and Pedagogies

2: Adapting Teaching Methods to Diverse Learners & Assessing Learning Outcomes

3: Enhancing Teaching Quality & Engaging and Motivating Students

4: Effective Teaching Delivery Techniques & Technology Integration in Teaching

5: Classroom Management and Time Management & Evaluation and Improvement of Teaching
targetAudiences: All UG and PG Education, Eductional Psychology, Business & IT Students
Interested students to learn about the concepts of Teaching Methods, Teaching Quality & Teaching Delivery

courseDetails.title: Master Course in Operations, Logistics and lean management
courseDetails.shortDescription: Operations, Logistics and lean management, Operations Management, Logistics Management, Supply Chain management
courseDetails.longDescription:
Master course in Operations, Logistics, and Lean Management

This comprehensive course aims to equip students with a solid understanding of operations management, logistics, and lean principles. Participants will learn how to streamline processes, optimize resources, and eliminate waste to enhance overall efficiency and effectiveness in various industries. The course combines theoretical knowledge with practical applications to prepare students for real-world challenges in the dynamic business environment.

In the fast-paced and ever-evolving business landscape, efficient operations, seamless logistics, and lean management practices are essential pillars for achieving success. These critical components form the backbone of a well-oiled organizational machine, ensuring smooth processes, cost-effectiveness, and optimal resource utilization. In this master course, we will delve into the world of Operations, Logistics, and Lean Management and explore their significance in driving productivity, profitability, and customer satisfaction.

The Importance of a Master Course in Opeartions, Logistics, and Lean Management

  1. Enhanced Employability: Graduates with expertise in operations, logistics, and lean management are highly sought after in a wide range of industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, retail, and transportation. These professionals are equipped to handle complex challenges and drive cost-effective solutions.

  2. Strategic Decision-Making: The course equips students with analytical skills to evaluate data, identify bottlenecks, and devise strategic plans to optimize operations and logistics. Lean management principles aid in making informed decisions to improve processes and eliminate inefficiencies.

  3. Global Perspective: In an increasingly interconnected world, supply chains span the globe. A master's course in this field provides students with insights into global logistics, international trade, and cultural nuances that affect operations and decision-making.

  4. Sustainability: Lean principles go hand in hand with sustainable practices, encouraging students to develop environmentally friendly and socially responsible approaches to business operations.

  5. Continuous Improvement: The journey towards operational excellence never truly ends. Graduates of this course develop a mindset of continuous improvement, staying up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies to maintain a competitive edge.

Curriculum Highlights

  1. Operations Management Fundamentals: Introduction to key concepts and techniques used in operations management, including process mapping, capacity planning, and quality management.

  2. Logistics and Supply Chain Management: Understanding the end-to-end supply chain process, inventory management, transportation, and distribution strategies.

  3. Lean Principles and Tools: In-depth exploration of lean principles, lean manufacturing, and lean Six Sigma methodologies to minimize waste and improve efficiency.

  4. Data Analytics and Optimization: Leveraging data to make data-driven decisions, using statistical analysis and optimization models to improve processes.

  5. Project Management: Developing essential project management skills to execute process improvement initiatives successfully.

  6. Sustainability and Corporate Social Responsibility: Examining the impact of operations and logistics on the environment and society, and exploring sustainable business practices.

Career Opportunities

CFD analysis and optimization using SolidWorks topics are covered in every video. The videos discuss problems unique to their industry and illustrate them with straightforward examples. This course was developed with intermediate and advanced students in mind. 


Unit 1: The Effects of Reduced Nozzle Size and Obstacles on the Flow of Fluids

Learning outcome: Students will be able to solve the characteristics of flowing stream in a reduction nozzle.

Problem: Find the characteristics of the flowing stream in a nozzle, knowing that a sphere is located in the space between the higher diameter pipe and the reduction zone.

Questions to solve:

  1. The average velocity at the outlet.

  2. Velocity flow field.

  3. Pressure distribution within the fluid.

  4. Pressure at the surface of the sphere.

  5. Pressure at the surface of the duct.


Unit 2: Loss coefficient calculations under different conditions

Learning outcome: Students will be able to estimate the loss coefficient under different operating levels.

Problem: Estimate the loss coefficient in a ball valve under different opening levels.

Questions to solve:

Given the formulas for loss of coefficient and Reynolds number, we will find:

  1. The calibration curve when the valve opening is at 0 degrees.

  2. The calibration curve when the valve opening is at 10 degrees.

  3. The calibration curve when the valve opening is at 15 degrees.

  4. The calibration curve when the valve opens at 20 degrees

  5. extract the data into an excel sheet and graph all the results at different angles.


Unit 3: Fluid characteristics of a counter-current heat exchanger

Learning outcome: Students will be able to set custom equations to solve complex heat transfer problems.

Objectives:

  • Set up a heat transfer model using the Simulation add-in in Solidworks

  • Show how to specify fluid subdomains when multiple fluids are required.

  • Show how to specify solid domains.

  • Set custom equations by using the Goals feature.

Problem:

Simulate a counter-current two-pipe heat exchanger.

Questions to solve:

Determine:

  1. The outlet temperature of both streams.

  2. Display the inlet and outlet velocities of both streams.

  3. Display a Cut Plot for the temperature.

  4. Display a flow trajectory plot for the temperature.

  5. Estimate the Log Mean Temperature Difference (LMTD).


Unit 4: The Effects of ventilation systems on the CO2 within an indoor space

Description:

COVID-19 has been a major public health concern after its outbreak in early 2020. An indirect way of estimating the probability of the presence of the SARS-CoV-2 in an indoor environment is by measuring the concentration of CO2 in the air. CO2 is a regular component of the air at a concentration of around 400ppm. However, in poorly ventilated facilities, this concentration can rise to an unsafe level.

Problem:

Simulate the ventilation of a classroom with an initial CO2 concentration in the air of 900 ppm. Use a time-dependant approach to track the change in concentration in the room.


Questions to solve:

Determine:

  1. Demonstrate the use of the design features such as: Convert Entities, Extruded Cut, and Extruded Boss/Base

  2. Simulate the transport of multiple species.

  3. Demonstrate how to specify the presence and concentration values of multiple species.

  4. Demonstrate how to specify a time-dependant model.

courseDetails.title: Angular, Unit Testing, and Figma
courseDetails.shortDescription: Building a simple dashboard using Angular Material
courseDetails.longDescription:
“Every web developer relies heavily on one web framework or another

(sometimes more if their services have different requirements) and

companies will rely on many frameworks, but each has its own pros and

cons.” Jay Bell, Greg Magolan, David Guijarro, Adrien de Peretti, Patrick Housley talking about NestJS

You may want to see the article "Computer programmers behave like drug addicted" Jorge Guerra Pires, PhD Published in Geek Culture, regarding bad reviews here.

==

Angular is a Google framework: it is a Single Application Page (SPA) generator.

With Angular, you can build apps that runs on browsers (frontend), no need of backend frameworks/libraries such as Express/Node.js/NestJS. With current achievements by the Angular community, you can now do essentially anything on the frontend. Recently, Firebase, also from Google, was integrated into Angular: Firebase provides several nice features, e.g., machine learning and Google based login.

Some strong points of Angular:

1. Was designed to be tested (i.e., ideal for unit testing-based apps; e.g., Test Driven Development), the Angular creators created standard tests, and constantly release new ways of easily testing apps using their libraries. With Jasmine/Karma, you can do essentially all kinds of unit tests;

2. It goes well with other technologies also from Google, see my articles on Medium "Firebase and Angular: connect your frontend app to a noSQL database" and "Meet my project “TensorFlow.js in Angular”: working on Angular based machine learning apps";

See my article on Medium "Does Angular really suck: why I have to disagree!".

This is a several volumes course. On this volume, you shall learn how to build a simple dashboard, to be continued in future volumes: we are going to cover the logged-out user version. The full app is already available on GitHub, under MIT license. As a result, this course can be followed by anyone wanting to learn Angular.

This volume is quite generic, and can be followed by anyone wanting to learn Angular focused on unit testing with Jasmine/Karma.

We are going to build a page on this volume, with a footer and header, with a background. The header has an Angular Material menu. We used Figma to draw the page before it was built, and borrowed CSS codes from the Figma project.

Even though the app we built here is simple, we cover several topics:

1. Unit testing Angular components;

2. Creating Angular components;

3. Using Angular Material;

4. Using Figma alongside Angular, not just as a visual aid, but also as a CSS code provider;

Resource that comes alongside the course:

· GitHub repository with all codes divided by modules;

· GitBook with extra explanations;

· Newsletter from time to time, delivered to your e-mail box;

· Q&A section, inside the platform;

· Constant upgrades on the course, no need to buy again!

· And more, check it out!

See that the full app is already available, including the numerical part, and you can after completing the course, just go on studying the codes already on GitHub. I have published a NPM library for this app called ngx-mat-miyagi-dolab. Just give it a try: npm i ngx-mat-miyagi-dolab

Join me on this endeavor!

Would you like to know more about my thinking patterns? now my e-book is on Amazon! Look for “My selected assays from Medium on Computer programming: Angular, JavaScript, Machine Learning, TensorFlow.js and more!”

Good studies! Learning is a journey that starts with wanting to learn!

About my past experience and expertise

I have done a postdoc where I have developed a platform in Angular from scratch, alone as programmer, on the Angular part. See “Galaxy and MEAN Stack to Create a User-Friendly Workflow for the Rational Optimization of Cancer Chemotherapy, published in Frontiers in Genetics”.

Feel free to Google me!
